trustfund: TF033198-SLOVENIA - ENVIRONMENTAL PROJECT,TF033174-SLOVENIA - ENVIRONMENTAL PROJECT,TF033171-SLOVENIA - ENVIRONMENTAL PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall achievement of the project
            objectives are judged to be highly satisfactory, with
            project sustainability highly likely. World Bank and
            Borrower performances were highly satisfactory overall.
            Theses were the lessons learned: to promote environmental
            investments which otherwise may not at all, or only very
            slowly, come about, the low cost-directed credit of the
            Ekofund for the funding of air pollution abatement projects
            was welcome, timely, and successful. And the successful
            implementation of the air pollution abatement program (APAP)
            component helped alert commercial banks to compete for this
            market so that in the near future the program would no
            longer be needed. It is important to carefully design such a
            program, to keep procedures simple, to conduct regular
            public relations campaigns, and to address potential
            customers even directly. Also, the administration of the
            program has to be carefully planned and implemented. This
            could be achieved by launching a pilot phase on a limited
            scope and choosing professional implementers. A lot of early
            campaigning had to be done to provide knowledge about the
            Geographical Information Systems (GIS) and to report the
            multifold benefits which could be derived from relatively
            small investments. This understanding is important since
            constant and sustained cooperation with potential clients
            and users for new systems, as well as sustained training of
            future users, are essential ingredients for a successful project.
